characteristics.description: 1" purplish-red cherry, prolific vines, 6-8 fruits per truss
Deeply ribbed 6-8 oz fruits, thick walls, meaty texture
Cylindrical cream to pale yellow, compact plants, best harvested at 3"
Dark purplish-brown 2-oz cherry, high anthocyanin, 6-8 per cluster, 5' vines
Compact cherry, 1/2-oz yellow fruits, container-friendly
Large beefsteak, yellow-orange with red hints
Extra-prolific cherry, long multiple-branched clusters
30" plants, 4-5" medium-hot, mature green to dark red
1.5" sweet with candy cane stripes, variegated foliage, ripen green/white to chocolate red/cream
2-4" slender, citrusy slightly smoky, 50-200 Scoville (mildly hot), highly productive
Compact 8" plants, upright 1.5-3" red, 50,000-100,000 Scoville units
Flowers early summer. Deep green buds with light purple tint. 3-4 heads per summer
Spineless, early mature, productive. Dark green grooved straight pods, full-bodied flavor. Beautiful flowers
Stunning crimson pods, yellow flowers, prolific in heat. Most productive red variety, tender 6" pods. AAS winner 1988
Prolific leaf growth, deep emerald glossy green, herbal tower form. Delays flowering 12+ weeks. Annual
Mild sweet taste, perfect for pesto/pasta/salads. Pink-tinted vinegar/oil. Tomato companion. Annual

Popular in SE Asian cuisine, holds flavor after cooking. Dark purple flowers, anise/clove hints. 12-18" tall. Harvest morning when cool. Complete harvest before flowering. Cut to 4-6" for second growth. Terrific for containers. Annual
10-18" tall. Edible flowers. Grows best in clumps. Frost hardy. Perennial
12-28" tall. Cool season crop (50-85°F ideal). Leaves=cilantro, seeds=coriander. Bolts above 85°F. Tolerates light frost. Annual
24-36" tall. Low water needs except in containers. Heat and frost tolerant. Annual
18-24" tall. Perennial in Zone 5+. 2nd year maturity. Well-drained, fairly dry soil. Trim every 3 years. Heat tolerant
Perennial in Zone 6+. Versatile for drinks, jellies, dishes, crafts, bath. Deer resistant
18-24" tall. Perennial. Enhances drinks, savory dishes, meats, stews. Tiny flowers attract bees. Great for pollinators. Deer resistant. Prefers partial shade in hot climates.
Perennial (zones 4-10), will spread by rhizomes. Heat and frost tolerant. Water when soil is dry. Excellent for pizza, pasta, tomato sauces. Can remain evergreen in mild winters.
Biennial. Leaves 1st year, flowers/seed 2nd year. Annual plantings recommended. Keep moist. Tolerates frost.
Perennial zone 8+, annual elsewhere. Piney flavor for meats/veggies/bread. Lavender flowers attract pollinators. Drought tolerant. Deer resistant.
Perennial. Loves dry, dislikes humidity. Heat tolerant, frost hardy to 15°F. Max 50% harvest. Let establish before first harvest.
Perennial. Heat and frost tolerant. Shear whole plant at 4" if spindly for denser regrowth.
Vigorous climbing Asian vine, flourishes in heat/humidity. Glossy thick leaves, mild Swiss chard-like taste. Rambling stems require trellis support. Dies at first frost.
Vigorous climbing vine, loves summer heat/humidity. Glossy thick leaves with red/purple stems, mild Swiss chard taste. Rambling stems require trellis. Dies at first frost.
Crisp loose leaf heads with broad, light-green, frilled and crumpled leaves. Delicate flavor. Heat-sensitive.
Custom mesclun blend for fresh salads. No thinning required for baby greens. Broadcast sowing. Light aids germination.
Peppery pungent flavor, high in vitamins A/C/K, potassium, calcium. Requires constant moisture. Grows in moist shady areas, containers, or near water.
Compact 20-24" stalks bear 50-100 dark-green 1¼-1½" sprouts. Excellent nutrition, freezes well. Cool season crop.
Tall cylindrical heads of tender, sweet Chinese cabbage. Cool season crop.
Blend of Red and White Russian. Deeply seriated curly leaves, tender for salad/bunching. Medium-tall plants, frost improves flavor.
Fast-growing, peppery spicy flavor. Young leaves mild for salads, mature best cooked. Cold hardy.
Tropical rhizome with pungent, spicy flavor. Grocery store ginger works - choose organic with visible buds. Best grown in containers. Goes dormant in winter.
Heirloom since 1892. Tender buttery-sweet 2½-3" deep crimson beets, won't get woody when large. Greens tasty, iron-rich. Perfect for pickling/roasting/raw. Frost tolerant.

Cool season crop. Use certified seed potatoes for best results. Grocery store potatoes may be treated with sprout inhibitors but can work. Gold-fleshed variety with creamy texture, ideal for all-purpose cooking.
Bred by Sugar Snap creator. Stringless pods, short 24-30" vines, improved disease resistance. No support needed but helps harvest. Powdery mildew resistant, bean leaf roll virus tolerant.
High yielding 12" bunching onions (scallions) with sweet, mild flavor. Cold hardy, can overwinter in Austin.
Mixed shades of blue, pink, ruby-red and white. Larger blooms than common Bachelor Buttons. Prolific bloomer, minimal care. Cool season annual.
Compact uniform red cockscomb, hundreds of tiny flowers in tight waves. Long-lasting cut flower. Attracts pollinators summer to frost. Heat/drought tolerant. 16-30" tall.
Lacy sprays of tiny celestial blue blossoms. Compact, tough, versatile plants. Attracts bees. Good for containers. 15-18" tall.
Biennial/short-lived perennial. Leafy spikes of bell-shaped blooms. White/shell-pink/deep-rose with crimson/maroon/chocolate markings. 4 ft tall. Part shade. POISONOUS - do not ingest seeds.

Large majestic 4" blooms in tangerine orange, rich gold, and lemony yellow. Mounding form, consistent height, sturdy stalks. Long-lasting cut flowers. Drought tolerant. Deer/rabbit resistant. Attracts butterflies. 24-36" tall.
Giant cactus flowered blooms in brilliant color blend. Quilled, gracefully curved petals in multiple rows. Excellent cut flowers. 2-3 ft tall.
Colorful foliage blend: white/bronze/gold/copper/yellow/pink/red/purple. Excellent for shade and containers. Deer resistant. Great houseplant. 12-36" tall, 6-18" wide.
